p: Reviewer #4:Â This is a very interesting article about social learning models. Combining semi-structured interviews, participant observation, checklist interviews, and a detailed social network analysis, authors assess different hypotheses about the social learning processes that shape medicinal plant knowledge across four villages in Solomon Islands. Hypothesis are well defined and presented, the text is clear and easy to follow. Figures and Tables are very informative. While I support the publication of this paper, there are few issues needed to be addressed beforehand. In general, the manuscript needs a larger cultural context, and a discussion that must go beyond of the exponential random graph models (ERGMs) findings:
